page.title: 15INDUSTRY - TYNE SHIPYARDS
page.content: In 1984{Middle Docks and Wallsend {Drydocks}were purchased by{Tyne {Shiprepair}from{British {Shipbuilders.}Ships have been repaired at Middle Docks since 1870.They have four drydocks suitable for any vessel from small offshore supply boats to vessels up to 50,000 d.w.t.In Middle Docks we saw the drydocks where the ships rest on keel blocks and the sides are supported by bilge blocks. The Royal Navy Frigate{H.M.S. Euryalus was in for refit.We also saw The {Seaforth Crusader,}an oil rig supply vessel, built in Singapore.There were three tug boats,{The Seasider, {The Ironsider}and{The}Tynesider.500 men work at the Middle Dock and if there is an important job to be completed then up to 1,000 men can be employed.
